title: (x) Zero Skateboards - Addmorph {Karl Frankowski}
content:
First time post... just came across the site! Does anyone know what this typeface (or similar) is called and where I might be able to find it so I can buy it?   
   
 ![ZERO](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/18489.gif)   
   
Thanks for your help...
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Yves,   
   
I think you are remembering T-26's ["Entropy"](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/entropy/) and ['Osprey"](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/osprey/) which were hybrid fonts made from overlaying parts of various letters to look like other letters. I think this could simply be someone's own 'homage' to one of those designs.

![admorph](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/18578.gif)   
   
It's addmorph with a fake bold applied. I can not find a sample online. [Here is what I did find](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437/http:/www.emigre.com/ArticleCoppingAnAttitude.php). Brian Schorn designed addmorph while at cranbrook in 1993 though because it was based upon Twombly's trajan, a licensing dispute ensued and the font was never released.I have no idea where it came from, but I have a copy of this typeface. (?!?)

No, that's definitely a font, I've seen it before.   
I think it's something like early [T-26](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437/http:/www.t26.com/changeyourface.php).

No Mike, I'm pretty sure, because I recognize the   
methodics in constructing the letters, which struck   
me when I first saw the face. While Entropy\* and   
Osprey\*\* are hybrids constructed from two or more   
fonts\*\*\*, this one is assembled by fusing parts of   
the next letter in the alphabet of the same typeface   
(Trajan by the looks of it).   
   
\* **Entropy** is uppercase _Missive_ fused to lowercase   
_Memphis_. **Missive** itself looks like a mix of _Garamond_  
and _Trade Gothic_.   
\*\* **Osprey** is basically _Entropy_ with _Park Avenue_ lower-   
case thrown in for added flavour. How far can you go?   
\*\*\* a popular practice in the deconstructivist heydays   
of the early nineties; see also P. Scott Makela's   
 [Dead History](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=88) (Linotype Centennial and VAG Rounded)   
and Max Kisman's [Fudoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437/http:/www.identifont.com/show?M0) (you can guess which faces).

And how could I forget to mention Jonathan Barnbrook's   
astounding [Prototype](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437/http:/www.virusfonts.com/spec%20sheets/prototype.html)...

Eureka! In the meanwhile I remembered where I saw it:   
in one of those typography books that erupted after   
the hugely successful and influential [Typography Now:](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/1873968426/qid=1066202594/sr=1-1/ref=sr_1_1/102-6950407-1933724?v=glance&s=books)  
 [The Next Wave](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/1873968426/qid=1066202594/sr=1-1/ref=sr_1_1/102-6950407-1933724?v=glance&s=books). I still haven't found in which particular   
book though. Good one Karl!

Fused Faces are Fun\* ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
 ![LucienGoethals70.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130914174437im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/18636.gif)   
   
\* but it's more fun when you fuse them yourself.
custom? I can see a Z + & and R +S and a O + R mixed...
